intro: Gambeya taiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi gambuya, is a species of flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
